job_title: Business Process Analyst E, FIS University Program
location: 4900 West Brown Deer Road, Brown Deer, WI 53223
full_description:
\n
Position Type :
Full time\n
Type Of Hire :
Associate Development Program (Full Time Hire)\n
Education Desired :
Bachelor's Degree\n
Travel Percentage :
0%\n
\n
Job Description
\n
Every day, our teams innovate across the world of finance. We collaborate to work smarter, while making a difference. We believe in diversity and inclusivity, giving a voice to everyone on the team. And we celebrate our success together. If you want to make an impact in fintech, we’d like to know: Are you FIS?
\n
\n
Join the 2026 FIS University Program!
\n
\n
As a full-time employee in the FIS University Program, you will have the opportunity to participate in team projects, community service activities, professional development seminars and work with a team that is invested in your growth, development, and success; including bi-annual performance connects with your manager.
\n
\n
This two-year full-time program has start dates in January, March, June, and September with a dedicated “Learning Week” where you will:
\n
\n
Learn how to work within a corporate environment
\n
Learn about the exciting world of Fintech and the role FIS plays
\n
Hear from FIS leadership about their journey and participate in senior leader networking opportunities
\n
Build a network of your peers from across the organization
\n
\n
\n
This position is for a June 22, 2026 start.
\n
\n
About The Role
\n
\n
Are you passionate about uncovering insights hidden in data? Join our Commercial Data & Analytics team as a Business Process Analyst and kickstart your career in fintech. In this role, you’ll dive into real-world datasets, build compelling visualizations, and help shape smarter business decisions across our global organization. You’ll work alongside experienced mentors, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and see your work make a real impact. If you’re curious, analytical, and excited to grow, we want to hear from you.
\n
\n
About The Team
\n
\n
Our team turns data into action. We collaborate with teams across FIS to solve real business challenges using data-driven insights. Whether we’re building solutions in Microsoft Fabric or automating workflows with Power Automate, we use modern tools to work smarter and faster. You’ll join a supportive, collaborative group that values curiosity, creativity, and continuous learning. Together, we build solutions that make a measurable difference.
\n
\n
What You Will Be Doing
\n
\n
Dive into data to uncover trends, patterns, and opportunities
\n
Collaborate with teams to understand business needs and design data-driven solutions
\n
Develop data pipelines and automation scripts in Python in Microsoft Fabric
\n
Design semantic models and build Power BI dashboards that apply star schema, DAX, and performance optimization techniques
\n
Test and refine our solutions to ensure they deliver real value
\n
\n
\n
What You Bring
\n
\n
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study
\n
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
\n
Fluent in English; Strong written and verbal communication skills
\n
Adaptability, a drive to learn, and strong problem-solving skills
\n
Ability to work well independently and within a team
\n
\n
\n
Bonus If You Have
\n
\n
You’re naturally curious and love learning new things
\n
You take ownership and follow through on your commitments
\n
You’ve built a portfolio of personal or academic data projects
\n
You’ve explored Python data visualization libraries like seaborn or matplotlib
\n
You’re interested in statistics, machine learning, or AI
\n
You thrive in collaborative, team-first environments
\n
\n
\n
What We Offer You
\n
\n
Competitive salary and excellent benefits
\n
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
\n
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – FIS is your final career step!
\n
Time to support charities and give back to your community
\n
A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility, and respect
\n
Student Loan Repayment Program: FIS will
PAY OFF
participants’ undergraduate loan balance over 10 years of service! Eligibility starts after one year of tenure in the program. The benefit applied to undergraduate student loans for US-based degrees and must be in the employee’s name.
\n
\n
\n
*Current and future sponsorship are not available for this position*
\n
\n

\n

Sourcing Model
\n
\n
Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
